conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Point A is located at the top left, above a blue baffle that slopes downward to the left.
Liquid from Point A flows downward and meets the blue baffle.
Liquid from Point A travels along the blue baffle to the left.
Liquid from Point A ends up in the yellow container (E).
Point B is located to the right of Point A, above the same blue baffle that slopes downward to the left.
Liquid from Point B flows downward and meets the blue baffle.
Liquid from Point B travels along the blue baffle to the left.
Liquid from Point B joins the flow from Point A and ends up in the yellow container (E).
Point C is located to the right of Point B, above the same blue baffle that slopes downward to the left.
Liquid from Point C flows downward and meets the blue baffle.
Liquid from Point C travels along the blue baffle to the left.
Liquid from Point C joins the flow from Points A and B, ending up in the yellow container (E).
Point D is located at the top right, above a gray baffle that slopes downward to the right.
Liquid from Point D flows downward and meets the gray baffle.
Liquid from Point D travels along the gray baffle to the right.
Liquid from Point D ends up in the blue container (G).
The liquid from Points A, B, and C flows into the yellow container (E).
The liquid from Point D flows into the blue container (G).
Final Answer: The liquid will flow into containers E and G.
